text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Group of prominent market makers on Amsterdam's options exchange plans to challenge stock exchange's six market makers by setting up in opposition to them. (p1)
- Tulip Computers' shares rise on rumours of bid from Commodore of U.S. (p11)
- Consumer group Consumentenbond threatens legal action if regional energy company REMU tries to limit damages arising from power failure in central Netherlands on Monday. (p6)
- ABN AMRO wins 67 million guilder legal claim against collapsed clothing company Van Gils. (p2)
- Former director sues data and telecommunications company Datelnet for 13 million guilders. (p23)
- Dutch companies must give shareholders detailed insight into rules on management options packages, says independent committee. (p27)
- Dutch trade union body FNV wants government to set aside 2.5 billion guilders each year for poor through higher wages and cheaper loans. (p1)
- Units of ING Groep and Koninklijke PTT Nederland expected to fail in joint bid to buy 6,000 post offices in Argentina because of legal hitch (p11).
